mn3:8.2.pli: Lobhassa ca pahānāya dosassa ca pahānāya atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
mn3:8.2.en: There is a [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m for giving up greed and hate. It gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

mn3:8.3.pli: Katamā ca sā, āvuso, majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati?
mn3:8.3.en: And what is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m?

mn3:8.6.pli: Ayaṁ kho sā, āvuso, majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
mn3:8.6.en: This is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

mn3:9-15.8.pli: Madassa ca pahānāya pamādassa ca pahānāya atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
mn3:9-15.8.en: There is a [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m for giving up vanity and negligence. It gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

mn3:9-15.9.pli: Katamā ca sā, āvuso, majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati?
mn3:9-15.9.en: And what is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m?

mn3:9-15.12.pli: Ayaṁ kho sā, āvuso, majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattatī”ti.
mn3:9-15.12.en: This is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.”

mn139:3.2.pli: Ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
mn139:3.2.en: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

mn139:5.1.pli: ‘Ete kho ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattatī’ti—
mn139:5.1.en: ‘Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.’

mn139:5.5.pli: ‘Ete kho ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattatī’ti—
mn139:5.5.en: ‘Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.’

mn139:13.13.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṁ majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā, cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati, adukkho eso dhammo anupaghāto anupāyāso apariḷāho;
mn139:13.13.en: The [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m by which the Realized One was awakened gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment. It is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.

sn56.11:2.4.pli: Ete kho, bhikkhave, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
sn56.11:2.4.en: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn56.11:3.1.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati?
sn56.11:3.1.en: And what is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m?

sn56.11:3.4.pli: Ayaṁ kho sā, bhikkhave, majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
sn56.11:3.4.en: This is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn42.12:2.3.pli: Ete te, gāmaṇi, ubho ante anupagamma majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā—cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
sn42.12:2.3.en: Avoiding these two extremes, the Realized One woke up by understanding the [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.

sn42.12:2.4.pli: Katamā ca sā, gāmaṇi, majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā—cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati?
sn42.12:2.4.en: And what is that [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m?

sn42.12:2.7.pli: Ayaṁ kho sā, gāmaṇi, majjhimā paṭipadā tathāgatena abhisambuddhā—cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
sn42.12:2.7.en: This, chief, is the [38;5;121mmiddle way of practice[0m, woken up to by the Realized One, which gives vision and knowledge, and leads to peace, direct knowledge, awakening, and extinguishment.
